metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Responsive Web Design
Responsive web design is about creating web pages that look good on all devices!
content.html: Responsive web design is about creating web pages that look good on all devices!

content.text: A responsive web design will automatically adjust for different screen sizes and viewports.
content.html: A responsive web design will automatically adjust for different screen sizes and viewports.

content.text: What is Responsive Web Design?
Responsive Web Design is about using HTML and CSS to automatically resize, hide, shrink, or enlarge, a website, to make it look good on all devices (desktops, tablets, and phones):
content.html: Responsive Web Design is about using HTML and CSS to automatically resize, hide, shrink, or enlarge, a website, to make it look good on all devices (desktops, tablets, and phones):

content.text: Try it Yourself »
content.html: Try it Yourself »

content.text: Setting The Viewport
To create a responsive website, add the following <meta> tag to all your web pages:
content.html: To create a responsive website, add the following <meta> tag to all your web pages:

content.code_html: <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">

content.text: This will set the viewport of your page, which will give the browser instructions on how to control the page's dimensions and scaling.
content.html: This will set the viewport of your page, which will give the browser instructions on how to control the page's dimensions and scaling.

content.text: Here is an example of a web page without the viewport meta tag, and the same web page with the viewport meta tag:
content.html: Here is an example of a web page without the viewport meta tag, and the same web page with the viewport meta tag:

content.text: Tip: If you are browsing this page on a phone or a tablet, you can click on the two links above to see the difference.
content.html: Tip: If you are browsing this page on a phone or a tablet, you can click on the two links above to see the difference.

content.text: Responsive Images
Responsive images are images that scale nicely to fit any browser size.
content.html: Responsive images are images that scale nicely to fit any browser size.

content.text: Using the width Property
If the CSS width property is set to 100%, the image will be responsive and scale up and down:
content.html: If the CSS width property is set to 100%, the image will be responsive and scale up and down:

content.code_html: <img src="img_girl.jpg" style="width:100%;">

content.text: Notice that in the example above, the image can be scaled up to be larger than its original size. A better solution, in many cases, will be to use the max-width property instead.
content.html: Notice that in the example above, the image can be scaled up to be larger than its original size. A better solution, in many cases, will be to use the max-width property instead.

content.text: Using the max-width Property
If the max-width property is set to 100%, the image will scale down if it has to, but never scale up to be larger than its original size:
content.html: If the max-width property is set to 100%, the image will scale down if it has to, but never scale up to be larger than its original size:

content.code_html: <img src="img_girl.jpg" style="max-width:100%;height:auto;">

content.text: Show Different Images Depending on Browser Width
The HTML <picture> element allows you to define different images for different browser window sizes.
content.html: The HTML <picture> element allows you to define different images for different browser window sizes.

content.text: Resize the browser window to see how the image below changes depending on the width:
content.html: Resize the browser window to see how the image below changes depending on the width:

content.code_html:
<picture>
  <source srcset="img_smallflower.jpg" media="(max-width: 600px)">
  <source srcset="img_flowers.jpg" media="(max-width: 1500px)">
  <source srcset="flowers.jpg">
  <img src="img_smallflower.jpg" alt="Flowers">
</picture>

content.text: Responsive Text Size
The text size can be set with a "vw" unit, which means the "viewport width".
content.html: The text size can be set with a "vw" unit, which means the "viewport width".

content.text: That way the text size will follow the size of the browser window:
content.html: That way the text size will follow the size of the browser window:

content.text: Hello World
Resize the browser window to see how the text size scales.
content.html: Resize the browser window to see how the text size scales.

content.code_html: <h1 style="font-size:10vw">Hello World</h1>

content.text: Viewport is the browser window size. 1vw = 1% of viewport width. If the viewport is 50cm wide, 1vw is 0.5cm.
content.html: Viewport is the browser window size. 1vw = 1% of viewport width. If the viewport is 50cm wide, 1vw is 0.5cm.

content.text: Media Queries
In addition to resize text and images, it is also common to use media queries in responsive web pages.
content.html: In addition to resize text and images, it is also common to use media queries in responsive web pages.

content.text: With media queries you can define completely different styles for different browser sizes.
content.html: With media queries you can define completely different styles for different browser sizes.

content.text: Example: resize the browser window to see that the three div elements below will display horizontally on large screens and stack vertically on small screens:
content.html: Example: resize the browser window to see that the three div elements below will display horizontally on large screens and stack vertically on small screens:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
float: left;  
  width: 20%; /* The width is 20%, by default */
float: left;  width: 60%; /* The width is 60%, by default */

/* Use a media query to 
  add a breakpoint at 800px: */
width: 100%; /* The width is 100%, when the viewport is 800px or smaller */
/* The width is 100%, when the viewport is 800px or smaller */

content.code:
<style>.left, .right {  float: left;  
width: 20%; /* The width is 20%, by default */}.main {  float: left;  width: 60%; /* The width is 60%, by default */}/* Use a media query to
add a breakpoint at 800px: */@media screen and (max-width: 800px) {  .left,
.main, .right {
width: 100%; /* The width is 100%, when the viewport is 800px or smaller */
}}</style>

syntax_highlighting.text:
float: left;  
  width: 20%; /* The width is 20%, by default */
float: left;  width: 60%; /* The width is 60%, by default */

/* Use a media query to 
  add a breakpoint at 800px: */
width: 100%; /* The width is 100%, when the viewport is 800px or smaller */
/* The width is 100%, when the viewport is 800px or smaller */

content.code_html:
<style>
.left, .right {
  float: left;
  width: 20%; /* The width is 20%, by default */
}

.main {
  float: left;
  width: 60%; /* The width is 60%, by default */
}

/* Use a media query to add a breakpoint at 800px: */
@media screen and (max-width: 800px) {
  .left, .main, .right {
    width: 100%; /* The width is 100%, when the viewport is 800px or smaller */
  }
}
</style>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
float: left;  
  width: 20%; /* The width is 20%, by default */
float: left;  width: 60%; /* The width is 60%, by default */

/* Use a media query to 
  add a breakpoint at 800px: */
width: 100%; /* The width is 100%, when the viewport is 800px or smaller */
/* The width is 100%, when the viewport is 800px or smaller */

content.text: Tip: To learn more about Media Queries and Responsive Web Design, read our RWD Tutorial .
content.html: Tip: To learn more about Media Queries and Responsive Web Design, read our RWD Tutorial.

content.text: Responsive Web Page - Full Example
A responsive web page should look good on large desktop screens and on small mobile phones.
content.html: A responsive web page should look good on large desktop screens and on small mobile phones.

content.text: Try it Yourself »
content.html: Try it Yourself »

content.text: Ever heard about W3Schools Spaces ? Here you can create your website from scratch or use a template, and host it for free.
content.html: Ever heard about W3Schools Spaces? Here you can create your website from scratch or use a template, and host it for free.

content.text: * no credit card required
content.html: * no credit card required

content.text: Responsive Web Design - Frameworks
All popular CSS Frameworks offer responsive design.
content.html: All popular CSS Frameworks offer responsive design.

content.text: They are free, and easy to use.
content.html: They are free, and easy to use.

content.text: W3.CSS
W3.CSS is a modern CSS framework with support for desktop, tablet, and mobile design by default.
content.html: W3.CSS is a modern CSS framework with support for desktop, tablet, and mobile design by default.

content.text: W3.CSS is smaller and faster than similar CSS frameworks.
content.html: W3.CSS is smaller and faster than similar CSS frameworks.

content.text: W3.CSS is designed to be independent of jQuery or any other JavaScript library.
content.html: W3.CSS is designed to be independent of jQuery or any other JavaScript library.

content.text: W3.CSS Demo
Resize the page to see the responsiveness!
content.html: Resize the page to see the responsiveness!

content.text: London
London is the capital city of England.
content.html: London is the capital city of England.

content.text: It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom, with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.
content.html: It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom, with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.

content.text: Paris
Paris is the capital of France.
content.html: Paris is the capital of France.

content.text: The Paris area is one of the largest population centers in Europe, with more than 12 million inhabitants.
content.html: The Paris area is one of the largest population centers in Europe, with more than 12 million inhabitants.

content.text: Tokyo
Tokyo is the capital of Japan.
content.html: Tokyo is the capital of Japan.

content.text: It is the center of the Greater Tokyo Area, and the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
content.html: It is the center of the Greater Tokyo Area, and the most populous metropolitan area in the world.

content.code:
W3Schools Demo

 

Resize this responsive page!

 
   

London

   

London is the capital city of England.

   

It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom,     with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.

 
 
   

Paris

   

Paris is the capital of France.

   

The Paris area is one of the largest population centers in Europe,     with more than 12 million inhabitants.

 
 
   

Tokyo

   

Tokyo is the capital of Japan.

   

It is the center of the Greater Tokyo Area,     and the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
<title>W3.CSS</title>
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://www.w3schools.com/w3css/4/w3.css">
</head>
<body>

<div class="w3-container w3-green">
  <h1>W3Schools Demo</h1>
  <p>Resize this responsive page!</p>
</div>

<div class="w3-row-padding">
  <div class="w3-third">
    <h2>London</h2>
    <p>London is the capital city of England.</p>
    <p>It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom,
    with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.</p>
  </div>

  <div class="w3-third">
    <h2>Paris</h2>
    <p>Paris is the capital of France.</p>
    <p>The Paris area is one of the largest population centers in Europe,
    with more than 12 million inhabitants.</p>
  </div>

  <div class="w3-third">
    <h2>Tokyo</h2>
    <p>Tokyo is the capital of Japan.</p>
    <p>It is the center of the Greater Tokyo Area,
    and the most populous metropolitan area in the world.</p>
  </div>
</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: To learn more about W3.CSS, read our W3.CSS Tutorial .
content.html: To learn more about W3.CSS, read our W3.CSS Tutorial.

content.text: Bootstrap
Another popular CSS framework is Bootstrap:
content.html: Another popular CSS framework is Bootstrap:

content.code:
My First Bootstrap Page

 

Resize this responsive page to see the effect!

 
   
     

Column 1

     

Lorem ipsum...

   
   
     

Column 2

     

Lorem ipsum...

   
   
     

Column 3

     

Lorem ipsum...
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
<title>Bootstrap 5 Example</title>
<meta charset="utf-8">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
<link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.2.3/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.2.3/dist/js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js"></script>
</head>
<body>

<div class="container-fluid p-5 bg-primary text-white text-center">
  <h1>My First Bootstrap Page</h1>
  <p>Resize this responsive page to see the effect!</p>
</div>

<div class="container mt-5">
  <div class="row">
    <div class="col-sm-4">
      <h3>Column 1</h3>
      <p>Lorem ipsum...</p>
    </div>
    <div class="col-sm-4">
      <h3>Column 2</h3>
      <p>Lorem ipsum...</p>
    </div>
    <div class="col-sm-4">
      <h3>Column 3</h3>
      <p>Lorem ipsum...</p>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

content.text: To learn more about Bootstrap, go to our Bootstrap Tutorial .
content.html: To learn more about Bootstrap, go to our Bootstrap Tutorial.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
There is a CSS font size unit that sizes text in percent of the viewport, what unit is that?
content.html: There is a CSS font size unit that sizes text in percent of the viewport, what unit is that?
